Projects

Some of the stuff I've done!

Sensible Web Development

Companion text for a web development course which I am currently teaching for Fall 2014 at Lewis & Clark College.

Gradebook

A custom grade book application closely integrated with GitHub. Allows students to view their grades using a private URL as well as submit/resubmit assignments using git tags.

Spoke.coffee

A Startup Weekend project to take coffee orders via an app and deliver it to NW Portland via a web app. Winner of the PDXSW 2014 award for Best Customer Validation.

Trianglify

A low poly style background generator with d3.js.

Rick

Arduino keyboard emulation for a fun hardware prank.

Hackathon Starter Sinatra

A powerful, full-featured, and simple framework designed for use at Startup Weekend and hackathon style events. Currently in active development.

Where's Quinn

An ongoing project to log my adventures and travels. Just recieved a big overhaul to the frontend and backend interfaces.

Headlamp Dispatches

A stab at some travel/adventure writing. Still very much a work in progress.

What Else Would I Say?

A fun weekend project that mashes up your facebook statuses into amusingly bizzarre permutations.

Lisst

A simple Sinatra application for creating and editing lists online, with a responsive and minimalist design.

Sidekick

A responsive marketing site and a Kickstarter project for high-quality, low-cost iPad/tablet stands.

Source code for this site is available on GitHub. Have a comment, or want to get in touch? Email me at qr@qrohlf.com, or find me on Twitter, GitHub, and Keybase.
